_header: O sweet thought I never in no wise
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, Delight in his Mistress, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 90) — three 11-line stanzas (ababbccdeed) and 6-line Envoy (aabccb)

BLHar682.First Lines:
O Swete thought y neuyr in no wiseDeserven may the good þou
                    dost me lo…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…Forwhi gret almes don ye hardilyWhen that ye lust me newe
                    comfort prouyde
